author: rightovahere
body:
If you're a multinational that does business in a foreign country or region, you need to comply by that regions laws. You can't just tell a country to fuck off unless you want to be barred from doing business in that country for an indefinite period of time.

Nobody gives a fuck if Paraguay tells Nvidia that they'll have a monopoly, but they sure do if the USA or CN does.

China killed the qualcomm NXP merger a few years back due to antitrust concerns (and potentially some trade war fuckery), and that wasn't nearly as excessive compared to this. Nvidia controlling ARM would be insane.

author: ChingityChingtyChong
body: Because ARM operates on China. Like how China blocked Qualcomm from buying NXP, even though one is American and the other is Dutch.

author: guilleiguaran
body:
And now this need to be approved by gov entities in UK, US, EU and China.

This may be like the failed Qualcomm-NXP merger all over again.

author: yeetlord123661
body:
Qualcomm CEO: Steven Mollenkopf
NXP CEO: Richard L. Clemmer

I don't see any Huang's or Wang's in their name. QED.

author: jorlev
body: I own NXP for Autonomous Driving and 5G chips as well as their other portfolio of chip solutions.

author: kaposai
body: They could go ahead with the deal ignoring any oposition from China. But guess what, China could deny them doing business in China. This is why Qualcomm had to pull out of the NXP deal. Qualcomm couldnt afford losing their Chinese customers.

author: ImagineInfinity12345
body: Bizarrely, the ones with solid growth potential and a track reccord of earnings, but the ones people think this new age of tech stocks is going to displace. Question is, are they right. Take Paychex for example.

author: Sir_Dink
body:
>ADP only releases private numbers it has.

Pretty much this.

I don't know any small business owner who uses ADP. Mostly it's between Paychex and Square.

They likely have some way of extrapolating an estimate for the missing payroll data, but since covid effected small business payrolls disproportionately it likely messed up their method of divining the data they don't have.

author: UpSideofDown
body: Here’s my leaps shopping list:  COST, PAYX, PEP, JBHT, VZ, PYPL, SQ, PLD.  Sure bets looking at any of their charts...

author: Sir_Dink
body:
>Lots of places just straight closed and stopped running payroll but they didn't notify them of employee additions/subtractions.

Atleast from experience with Paychex self service, some fees are related to current head count. It makes little sense to not inform 3rd party payroll services you furloughed all workers and closed.
